      • TickMarkCalculator

        public TickMarkCalculator(int sequenceLength,
                  float tickDensity,
                  double desiredLengthPerMark,
                  float majorLengthProportion,
                  float minorLengthProportion)
        Creates a new tick mark calculator, used to calculate positions/lengths of tick marks.
        Parameters:
        sequenceLength - The length of the sequence.
        tickDensity - The density of the tick marks to create (from 0.0 to 1.0).

        public void changeBackboneLength(double backboneLength)
        Changes the backbone length we use to the passed value.
        Parameters:
        backboneLength - The current perceived length of the backbone.

      • createMarks

        public java.util.List<TickMark> createMarks(double initialBase,
                                   double finalBase)
        Creates tick mark objects for each tick mark to create in between the two passed bases. Only draws marks that lie within [initialBase, finalBase)
        Parameters:
        initialBase - The initial starting base in the range.
        finalBase - The final base in the range.
        Returns:
        A list of TickMark objects defining the tick marks to build around the sequence.

      • getLongestTickLabel

        public static java.lang.String getLongestTickLabel(int sequenceLength)
        Determines the longest (in terms of characters) tick mark label possible for the given sequence length.
        Parameters:
        sequenceLength - The sequence length to check against.
        Returns:
        The longest tick mark label possible.
